snippet: With a $226 million purchase in Boston, Jamestown Properties has become part of a submarket with nearly $2 billion in other projects in the works.
abstract: Atlanta-based Jamestown Properties has been thrust into a booming commercial property market in Boston following blockbuster deal in which it paid $226 million for a 130,000-square-foot portfolio spread over 28 buildings, mostly on the city's Newbury Street; nearly $2 billion in other projects are planned by Jamestown or being built in the area.
lead_paragraph: With a $226 million purchase in Boston, Jamestown Properties has become part of a submarket with nearly $2 billion in other projects in the works.

headline.seo: Jamestown Properties Finds a Boom in Boston’s Back Bay
headline.main: A Real Estate Company Finds a Boom in Boston’s Back Bay
headline.print_headline: A Real Estate Company Finds Itself Part of a Boom in Boston’s Back Bay
